department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Joshua has been a writer, director from an early age. Starting at 16, he spent ten years in an apprenticeship with world-class teacher and mentor Edward T. McDougal. Between 1997 and 2005 Josh ran two video production companies; wrote/co-wrote multiple screenplays; produced and directed several short films; received his BFA from NEIU; taught screenwriting and filmmaking in the states as well as abroad; worked as judge for the U.S. Film Festival and was a ghost writer and Unit Production Manager for the feature film DOG JACK. Joshua entered the indie film scene to immediate success after his directorial debut, FANCYPANTS, won a slew of festival awards and secured a limited theatrical release; his sophomore feature film, ABSOLUTION, has completed principal photography and will be released in 2015. Joshua has been a lecturer in the College of Computing and Digital Media at DePaul University since 2007.
